title: Standard Form
text: The standard form is $$x={a\left(y-h\right)}^2+k$$. We are given the equation in $$x=a y^2+b y+c$$.

title: Finding a
text: To find a, we must divide our $$a y^2$$ term by a by factoring by grouping.

title: Completing the Square
text: After we find a, our equation now looks like, $$a \left(y^2+\frac{b}{a} x\right)+c$$. We must complete the square by adding $${\left(\frac{\frac{b}{a}}{2}\right)}^2$$ into the parenthesis.

title: Completing the Square
text: Since we can't simply add a number out of thin air, we must take our equation and subtract it by what we added into the parenthesis.

title: Completing the Square
text: After doing so, our equation should now be in standard form.
